how does ubuntu handle multiple hd's. i have a windows home server that i am going to migrate to ubuntu with multiple drives
linux has one root file system and then "mounts" other drives onto emty folders in the file system
you know how Windows uses C:\ D:\ ect?
linux has one "C:\" named /
linux then puts "D:\" on an empty folder you chose on /
So I can make one drive for say movies and it will show up as a folder named movies
you would need to originally assign it to a folder
when you install ubuntu. It will ask you how you would like to partition. From there you are able to set mount points for each partition
